title: 947This is not acceptable use of taxpayer funds.posted8 hours agobykinbergfan18 commentsawardsharere
content:
949 This is not acceptable use of taxpayer funds. posted 8 hours ago by kinbergfan 18 comments award share report block Attorney General Ken Paxton @KenPaxtonTX • 1d 🚨BREAKING: I'm suing Harris County for unlawfully directing over $1.3 million in taxpayer money to defend illegal aliens from deportation. We must stop the left-wing radicals who are robbing Texans to prevent illegals from being deported by the Trump Administration.
18 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save DingleBalls 25 points 8 hours ago Illegals shouldn't have a "due process" or access to a lawyer. They have no rights permalink award report block reply XxxRDTPRNxxX 14 points 7 hours ago This talking point is a red herring. They do have rights, just being in the country isn't one of them. Since being in the country isn't a right, they aren't entitled to a hearing, lawyer, court, trial, etc...  before removal. The case law is Fong Yue ting v United Sates. Basically the country has the right to kick out any foreigner for any reason as determined by the executive branch. Only citizens have a constitutional right to not be exiled. permalink parent award report block reply AVeryNakedMan 3 points 5 hours ago So many retards don't understand basic concepts. "Due process" just means the law was followed. It doesn't mean you got a trial by jury. If the law says "all illegals get deported without a trial" then they get due process by being deported without a trial. permalink parent award report block reply Side_o_beef_curtains 2 points 5 hours ago I would like to draw your attention to Bing Dang Ow vs Florida and Sum Ting Wong vs California for further clarification. permalink parent award report block reply SpellingContable 1 points 2 hours ago Ho Le Phuc this always makes me kek. permalink parent award report block reply 19American62Woman -2 points 8 hours ago Texas just voted to give them the right to vote in our elections now because it’s Texifornia now. permalink parent award report block reply tholinz 11 points 8 hours ago Wrong. We passed a ballot measure to amend the state constitution to explicitly prohibit non-citizens from voting. https://news.ballotpedia.org/2025/11/05/texas-voters-approve-all-17-constitutional-amendments-including-prohibiting-certain-future-taxes-adding-parental-rights-and-prohibiting-noncitizens-from-voting-in-state-and-local-elections/ permalink parent award report block reply 19American62Woman 4 points 8 hours ago I’ve never been so happy to be wrong in my life! Wish I could remember which site ran the jibberish. A million thanks for the info. permalink parent award report block reply Im_RickSteves_bitch 6 points 8 hours ago Don’t sue them.
